Entry.JapaneseText: 男の人
Entry.EnglishText: Man

Entry.JapaneseText: <Claire>
Entry.EnglishText: <Claire>

Entry.JapaneseText: 製鉄工場
Entry.EnglishText: Iron Factory

Entry.JapaneseText: 製鉄工場
Entry.EnglishText: Iron Factory

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>この原版を持っていきますか？ 持っていく やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>Take the plate with you? Take it Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>原版を手に入れました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You took the plate.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>ここにあった原版を戻しますか？ 戻す やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>Put back the plate? Return it Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>原版を戻しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You put back the plate.

Entry.JapaneseText: 原版は四つまでしか 持つ事ができません。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You can only have up to four plates.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>ここにあった原版を戻しますか？ 戻す やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>Put back the plate? Return it Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>原版を戻しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You put back the plate.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『製鉄用の道具』 製鉄用の道具につき 持ち出し禁止。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Tools for Working Steel - Tools used for steelworking are prohibited from being taken outside the workplace.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『製鉄用の原版』 細かい模様が刻まれた 鉄を作るための型。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Steel Plate - A mold for making steel with fine patterns engraved on it.

Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You took the plate.

Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>Put back the plate? Return it Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>原版を戻しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You put back the plate.

Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You can only carry up to four plates.

Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>Put back the plate? Return it Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>原版を戻しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You put back the plate.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『製鉄用の道具』 製鉄用の道具につき 持ち出し禁止。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Tools for Working Steel - Tools used for steelworking are prohibited from being taken outside the workplace.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『製鉄用の原版』 細かい模様が刻まれた 鉄を作るための型。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Steel Plate - A mold for making steel with fine patterns engraved on it.

Entry.JapaneseText: 工場で変な事が起こるって言って まともに仕事をしないヤツがいるんだ。 ビビってないで仕事しろってんだよな。
Entry.EnglishText: There's a guy who won't do his job properly because he says that strange things keep happening at the factory. I told him to quit being a baby.

Entry.JapaneseText: 変わった事？ おとといから 設計士のガップラがいなくなって、 くだらない噂が広まってるぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: Anythting different? Well, two days ago our architect Gappler disappeared, and now there are absurd rumors going around.

Entry.JapaneseText: しまいには溶鉱炉に落ちたガップラの 怨念が工場で悪さをしてるって 言い出すヤツがでる始末だ……
Entry.EnglishText: I've heard that Gappler fell into the blast furnace and now his vengeful spirit is haunting the factory...

Entry.JapaneseText: 行方知れずのガップラの怨念が 工場で悪さをしてるだとか言って…… ビビってないで仕事しろってんだよな。
Entry.EnglishText: They keep saying that after Gappler went missing, his ghost started haunting the factory... I tell 'em to stop being babies and get back to work.

Entry.JapaneseText: 行方知れずのガップラの怨念が 工場で悪さをしてるだとか言って…… ビビってないで仕事しろってんだよな。
Entry.EnglishText: They keep saying that after Gappler went missing, his ghost started haunting the factory... I tell 'em to stop being babies and get back to work.

Entry.JapaneseText: 四、五日前にガップラに頼まれて、 溶鉱炉から持って来た鉄を磨いて ブローチにしてやったのが最後だ。
Entry.EnglishText: The last time I saw Gappler was four or five days ago when he asked me to burnish some iron he got from the blast furnace into a brooch.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何度も持って来て磨き直しを 頼まれたから、良く覚えてるぜ。 お前も鉄があるなら、磨いてやるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I remember it well because he asked me to do that for him several times. If you bring me some iron, I can burnish it for you too.

Entry.JapaneseText: 四、五日前にガップラが 溶鉱炉から持ってきた鉄を ブローチにしてやったぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: Four or five days ago, Gappler had me make some iron he got from the blast furnace into a brooch.

Entry.JapaneseText: これを磨いてくれって？ おう、まかせとけ！
Entry.EnglishText: You want me to burnish this for you? Sure thing, I'm on it!

Entry.JapaneseText: ほらよ。 ガップラに作ってやったブローチと、 寸分たがわねえ仕上がりだぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: Here you go. The finish for this brooch is just like the one I made for Gappler!

Entry.JapaneseText: 磨いてほしい物があったら、 いつでも言ってくれよ！
Entry.EnglishText: If you have anything you want me to burnish, feel free to ask me!

Entry.JapaneseText: 傷ひとつ残さずに ピカピカに磨き上げて みせるぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: I'll polish it up and make it sparkle without leaving behind a single scratch!

Entry.JapaneseText: この工場に恨みを持ったヤツの怨念が 溶鉱炉に出るようになったんだって、 昨日の夜に仲間から聞いたよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Last night, one of my cowarders said that the blast furnace is haunted by the ghost of someone who holds a grudge against this factory.

Entry.JapaneseText: 傷ひとつ残さずに ピカピカに磨き上げて みせるぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: I'll polish it up and make it sparkle without leaving behind a single scratch!

Entry.JapaneseText: 素人が勝手に機械をいじると 大変な事になる。
Entry.EnglishText: If an amateur were to tamper with the machinery without asking, then bad things would happen.

Entry.JapaneseText: ぜーーーーーーったいに …………………… 触るなよっっっっっ!!
Entry.EnglishText: So under ABSOLUTELY NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD YOU TOUCH IT!!!

Entry.JapaneseText: 立てこもっている人たちが、 部屋から出たくなるような 何かを起こせば……
Entry.EnglishText: They've barricaded themselves in there, but perhaps if something were to happen that would make them feel compelled to leave that room...

Entry.JapaneseText: あのレバーは……
Entry.EnglishText: That lever...

Entry.JapaneseText: コラッ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Hey!!

Entry.JapaneseText: 触るなよっ！
Entry.EnglishText: Don't touch that!

Entry.JapaneseText: 速度調節できない素人が 機械をいじったら、 大変な事になるんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: Someone without the proper training to control the speed of the machine shouldn't be operating it! Things could get really bad!

Entry.JapaneseText: 大変な事……？ どうなるのですか？
Entry.EnglishText: "Really bad?" How so, if I may ask?

Entry.JapaneseText: 機械が熱くなって、 工場の中が蒸し風呂みたいに なるんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: The machine would overheat, and cause the entire factory to feel like a sauna.

Entry.JapaneseText: （これだわ……）
Entry.EnglishText: (That could work.)

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: 柵が閉まっている……
Entry.EnglishText: The grating is shut...

Entry.JapaneseText: 柵が閉まってるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: The grating is shut.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄柵が閉まっているな。
Entry.EnglishText: The iron grating is shut.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄の柵が閉まってますね。
Entry.EnglishText: The iron grating is shut.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄の柵が閉まっているな。
Entry.EnglishText: The iron grating is shut.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄の柵が閉まっているわ。
Entry.EnglishText: The iron grating is shut.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄の柵が閉まっているわ……
Entry.EnglishText: The iron grating is shut.

Entry.JapaneseText: 鉄の柵が閉まっている。
Entry.EnglishText: The iron grating is shut.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>レバーがあります。 動かしますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>There is a lever. Pull it? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: さわるんじゃない。
Entry.EnglishText: Don't touch that!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green><scale:140>レバーを倒しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green><scale:140>You pulled the lever.
